content: easy knotted ear warmer this ear warmer works up fast and easy using single crochets working in the round it would make great gifts for those in your life who like ear warmers and headbands over hats this pattern is not to be sold or distributed without permission you may sell what you make using pattern but please make sure to give credit for the pattern materials - 3 0 mm crochet hook - lighter medium weight yarn approx 9-12 wpi i used lion brands a star is born nap time which when measured i got 11 wpi - cloth measuring tape - yarn needle - stitch marker notes - this pattern is adjustable in length i suggest making it about 2-4 inches shorter than your head circumference is so that it stays snug around your head from my experience it will stretch out just a little bit - to get the circumference of your head take your measuring tape and wrap it around your head just above/behind your ears with the end in the area of your forehead - pattern is worked in continuous rounds move stitch marker up as your work - when measuring the length of your ear warmer as you go be sure to not stretch it before you measure it this may lead to your ear warmer ending up too short in the end and not being able to stretch further to fit over your head/ears stitches used - chain chain - fsc foundation single_crochet there are amazing tutorials on how to do this on youtube - single_crochet single_crochet - slip_stitch slip stich gauge - 20sc by 23 row equals 4 inches - this really isn t important but with my yarn this is the gauge i had this pattern is not to be sold or distributed without permission you may sell what you make using pattern but please make sure to give credit for the pattern finished size - depending on the circumference of your head mine came out to be about 20 inches long before connecting ends together - the headband will be about 4 - 5 inches wide when laid flat before finishing instructions 1 fsc 40 or chain 41 and work single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and each chain across fold in half and start working in continuous rounds be sure to mark your first stitch 2 from now throughout single_crochet in each stitch around moving stitch marker up with each row 3 work in the round till the tube reaches the length needed at least 2-4 inches shorter than your heads circumference 4 lay tube on a flat surface with stitch marker on one edge of flattened tube working through the front loop of the stitches on the front side of the tube and back loops of the stitches on the other side of the tube slip_stitch tube closed on one end finish off 5 turn tube over to other end join yarn with a slip_stitch in first st
